requests.name: Dumex ( Dulac ) Stage 1
requests.description:
We reach out today on behalf of a young mother facing unimaginable challenges.

At just 21 years old, she is navigating the difficult path of single motherhood to her one-year-old son, without the support of her family.

Her parents have left her to manage on her own, and with no stable place to call home, she is struggling to provide the most necessities for her baby—milk, and diapers. 

With no steady income, she is tirelessly searching for work while balancing the overwhelming responsibilities of motherhood.

Her journey has been marked by hardship and heartbreak, and we humbly ask for your kindness to help her through these difficult times.

Your support can provide essential items that many of us take for granted, but that make all the difference in the world to her and her son.

Please help and donate DULAC STAGE 1 and BABY DIAPERS PANTS SIZE XL so that this young family finds hope and stability.

Every little bit counts and will bring her closer to a brighter future, free from the constant worry of how she will care for her child.

Thank you for your generosity and compassion!

requests.name: Medical-grade air purifier with HEPA filter
requests.description:
The family, consisting of parents and four young children (aged 4 months to 4 years), is currently experiencing financial hardship. They reside in a 1-room HDB rental flat. The father is unable to work due to spinal issues, as documented by a doctor’s memo, and the mother, the primary caregiver, has not been able to return to work due to the recent hospitalization of their 4-month-old baby. As a result, the family currently has no income, making it difficult to meet essential needs.

The youngest child (4 months old) was discharged earlier this October following hospitalization for an upper respiratory tract infection, with instructions to continue close monitoring. Two other children—(F, 2) and (M, 1)—have also experienced similar respiratory issues this year, requiring hospitalization and medical care.

Discharge Summaries:

(F, 2 years old)

Date: 7th January 2024
Diagnosis: Bronchopneumonia
Treatment: Treated with antibiotics and discharged with follow-up instructions.

(M, 1 years old)

Date: 28th February 2024
Diagnosis: Acute Bronchiolitis
Treatment: Managed with bronchodilators and symptomatic medications.

(4-month-old)

Date: 27th October 2024
Diagnosis: Upper Respiratory Tract Infection
Given the recurring respiratory conditions, the doctor recommended a medical-grade air purifier with a HEPA filter to improve indoor air quality. 

Your assistance would greatly benefit the family during this challenging time.
